TestCaseName: TC#001 - Verify that 'Process Monitor' product appears in the left-side menu and navigate to the 'Process Monitor' page
Description: Verify that 'Process Monitoring' appears in the left-side menu

Steps.StepName: Open the Eclipse Vantage application
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Application loads successfully.

Steps.StepName: Navigate to the left navigation menu and find Process Monitoring displays
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitoring product name is displayed

Steps.StepName: Navigate to the Process Monitoring page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitoring UI is displayed with expected elements.

TestCaseName: TC#002 - Verify that 'Process Monitor' is sorted alphabetically in the menu
Description: Verify that 'Process Monitoring' is sorted alphabetically in the menu

Steps.StepName: Open the Eclipse Vantage application
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Application loads successfully.

Steps.StepName: Navigate to the menu
Steps.StepExpectedResult: 'Process Monitoring' appears in correct alphabetical order.

TestCaseName: TC#003 - Verify that the correct icon (clipboard-list from Lucide, white) is shown
Description: Verify that the correct icon (clipboard-list from Lucide, white) is shown

Steps.StepName: Navigate to the left-side menu
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Clipboard-list icon is visible next to Process Monitoring menu.

TestCaseName: TC#004 - Verify that Process ID column is visible and populated
Description: Verify that Process ID column is visible and populated

Steps.StepName: Open Process Monitoring page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process ID column appears in the table and has values.

TestCaseName: TC#005 - Verify Process Type shows values like Contract, 835
Description: Verify Process Type shows values like Contract, 835

Steps.StepName: Inspect Process Type column
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Type displays correct values like Contract, 835.

TestCaseName: TC#006 - Verify Pending state shows correct icon and color (#878B8C)
Description: Verify Pending state shows correct icon and color (#878B8C)

Steps.StepName: Check a row with Pending state
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon appears with color #878B8C.

TestCaseName: TC#007 - Verify In Progress state shows correct icon and color (#F2682A)
Description: Verify In Progress state shows correct icon and color (#F2682A)

Steps.StepName: Check a row with In Progress state
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon appears with color #F2682A.

TestCaseName: TC#008 - Verify Completed state shows correct icon and color (#037E28)
Description: Verify Completed state shows correct icon and color (#037E28)

Steps.StepName: Check a row with Completed state
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon appears with color #037E28.

TestCaseName: TC#009 - Verify Failed state shows correct icon and color (#AA1B04)
Description: Verify Failed state shows correct icon and color (#AA1B04)

Steps.StepName: Check a row with Failed state
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon appears with color #AA1B04.

TestCaseName: TC#010 - Verify all icons are 16px in size
Description: Verify all icons are 16px in size

Steps.StepName: Inspect UI icons
Steps.StepExpectedResult: All icons are 16x16px.

TestCaseName: TC#011 - Verify bars have correct size (3x20px) and 4px padding
Description: Verify bars have correct size (3x20px) and 4px padding

Steps.StepName: Check visual styling of bars
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Bars have size 3x20px with 4px padding.

TestCaseName: TC#012 - Verify FilePresentIcon is shown with correct color (#24272A) and size (16px)
Description: Verify FilePresentIcon is shown with correct color (#24272A) and size (16px)

Steps.StepName: Locate FilePresentIcon in grid
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon color is #24272A and size is 16px.

TestCaseName: TC#013 - Verify visual indication (e.g., red icon or message) is shown for failed processes
Description: Verify visual indication (e.g., red icon or message) is shown for failed processes

Steps.StepName: Check a failed process row
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Red icon or error message is visible.

TestCaseName: TC#014 - Verify that each state (New, In Progress, Success, Failed) has a distinct icon and color
Description: Verify that each state (New, In Progress, Success, Failed) has a distinct icon and color

Steps.StepName: Inspect various states in the grid
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Each state has unique icon and color.

Steps.StepName: Check a process marked 'New'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Each state has unique icon and color.

TestCaseName: TC#015 - Verify in-progress status shows animated or dynamic visual indicator
Description: Verify in-progress status shows animated or dynamic visual indicator

Steps.StepName: Check a process marked 'In Progress'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Status icon or bar shows animation.

TestCaseName: TC#016 - Verify failed state has a visible error badge or red highlight
Description: Verify failed state has a visible error badge or red highlight

Steps.StepName: Check failed row styling
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon has red highlight or badge.

TestCaseName: TC#017 - Verify success state has a green check icon
Description: Verify success state has a green check icon

Steps.StepName: Check successful process row
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Green check icon is displayed.

TestCaseName: TC#018 - Verify AutoAwesome icon expand field in Process Monitor
Description: Verify that the AutoAwesome icon is displayed in the expand field of the Process Monitor row

Steps.StepName: Open the Eclipse Vantage application
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Application launches successfully

Steps.StepName: Click on Process Monitor Product
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Click the row on the table
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Row expands to show details

Steps.StepName: Verify the presence of AutoAwesome icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: AutoAwesome icon is displayed in the expanded row

TestCaseName: TC#019 - Verify AutoAwesome icon properties in expanded Process Monitor row
Description: Verify that the AutoAwesome icon in the expanded row has the correct color, size, padding, and alignment

Steps.StepName: Redirect to Process Monitor page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Check for presence of AutoAwesome icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: AutoAwesome icon is displayed within the expanded row

Steps.StepName: Verify the icon properties
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon matches the following properties: 20px size, color #CF4520 (Persimmon Medium), padding 8px left/right and 3px top/bottom, aligned left and bottom

TestCaseName: TC#020 - Verify Process Monitor product search field functionality
Description: Ensure that the search field in Process Monitor filters rows correctly when searching for 'Automatic'

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Verify the search field functionality
Steps.StepExpectedResult: When searching for 'Automatic', rows are displayed and each result contains the text 'Automatic'

TestCaseName: TC#021 - Verify scrolling loads all rows in Process Monitor
Description: Ensure that scrolling the table in Process Monitor loads all rows correctly

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed successfully

Steps.StepName: Scroll through the table to load all rows
Steps.StepExpectedResult: All rows are loaded as the user scrolls to the bottom of the table

TestCaseName: TC#022 - Verify waiting for minimum rows to load in Process Monitor
Description: Ensure that the table in Process Monitor waits until the expected minimum number of rows are loaded

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed successfully

Steps.StepName: Wait for the table rows to load
Steps.StepExpectedResult: The table waits until at least the expected minimum number of rows are loaded within the timeout

TestCaseName: TC#023 - Verify all headers are present in Process Monitor table
Description: Ensure that all expected headers are displayed in the Process Monitor table

Steps.StepName: Redirect to Process Monitor page
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Verify all headers are present in the table
Steps.StepExpectedResult: 'Type', 'Id', 'Description', 'Client', 'Source', 'Processed On', 'Duration', 'State', and 'Disposition' headers are displayed in the table

TestCaseName: TC#024 - Verify filtering by client in Process Monitor
Description: Verify that the Process Monitor correctly filters the table based on the selected client (e.g., 'processdb').

Steps.StepName: Open the Eclipse Vantage application
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Application launches successfully

Steps.StepName: Click on Process Monitor Product
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Wait for the 'Loading process logs...' text to disappear
Steps.StepExpectedResult: 'Loading process logs...' is no longer visible, and the page is ready for interaction

Steps.StepName: Click on the 'Client' filter dropdown
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Client filter options are displayed

Steps.StepName: Select 'processdb' from the client filter options
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table reloads and displays only rows with 'processdb' in the Client column

Steps.StepName: Verify all displayed rows have 'processdb' as the client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Each row in the 'Client' column contains the value 'processdb'

TestCaseName: TC#025 - Verify filtering by date range in Process Monitor
Description: Verify that the Process Monitor correctly filters records based on selected date ranges like Today, Last 7 Days, Last 14 Days, and Last 30 Days.

Steps.StepName: Open the Eclipse Vantage application
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Application launches successfully

Steps.StepName: Click on Process Monitor Product
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Wait for the 'Loading process logs...' message to disappear
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Loading message disappears, and the table becomes interactive

Steps.StepName: Click on the 'Client' filter and select 'processdb'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table reloads and displays rows with client 'processdb'

Steps.StepName: Click on the 'Date' filter
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Date filter options are displayed

Steps.StepName: Iterate through date options: Today, Last 7 Days, Last 14 Days, Last 30 Days
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table displays only the rows that match the selected date range

Steps.StepName: Verify each row has a valid 'Processed On' date for the selected range
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Each row in the 'Processed On' column is populated and not empty

TestCaseName: TC#026 - Filter by a single status in Process Monitor UI
Description: Verify that filtering by a single status in the Process Monitor UI correctly filters the displayed rows.

Steps.StepName: Fetch all statuses from /api/ProcessStatus
Steps.StepExpectedResult: List of statuses is retrieved

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days', status=selected status
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table updates and shows rows with selected status

Steps.StepName: Verify that all rows in the status column match selected status
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Each row's status matches the applied filter

TestCaseName: TC#027 - Filter by multiple statuses in Process Monitor UI
Description: Verify that selecting multiple statuses in the filter displays only matching entries in the table.

Steps.StepName: Fetch the first two available statuses from /api/ProcessStatus
Steps.StepExpectedResult: At least two valid statuses are retrieved

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days', status=[status1, status2]
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table updates and shows rows matching any of the selected statuses

Steps.StepName: Verify bottom-alignment of status icon in row (UI validation)
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Icon is correctly aligned based on layout expectations

TestCaseName: TC#028 - Compare UI row count with API data for filtered status
Description: Ensure that the number of rows shown in the UI after applying a status filter matches the count from the API.

Steps.StepName: Fetch all statuses from /api/ProcessStatus and select one
Steps.StepExpectedResult: A valid status is selected for testing

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days', and selected status
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Table updates and shows rows with selected status

Steps.StepName: Count number of matching rows in UI
Steps.StepExpectedResult: UI shows correct number of filtered rows

Steps.StepName: Make GET call to /api/Processes and count rows with same status
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Number of filtered items from API is retrieved

Steps.StepName: Compare UI row count with filtered API result count
Steps.StepExpectedResult: UI and API counts match for the selected status

TestCaseName: TC#029 - Error message for unconfigured database in Process Monitor UI
Description: Verify that the appropriate error message is shown when Process Monitor is accessed for a client without a configured database.

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor with an unconfigured client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page attempts to load

Steps.StepName: Wait for error message to appear
Steps.StepExpectedResult: System waits for the error message to load within a reasonable timeout

Steps.StepName: Verify presence of error message: 'There is no configured database for this client.'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Error message is visible and matches the expected text

TestCaseName: TC#030 - Process Monitor page remains visible after tab switch for ReviewClient
Description: Verify that the Process Monitor page stays responsive and does not go blank after switching to another browser tab and returning.

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Filters are applied and data is displayed

Steps.StepName: Open a new browser tab and navigate to an external site
Steps.StepExpectedResult: New tab opens and loads the external site

Steps.StepName: Wait for 2 minutes in the new tab
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Simulates user inactivity on the original tab

Steps.StepName: Switch back to the original Process Monitor tab
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Original tab is restored in focus

Steps.StepName: Interact with the Process Monitor page to verify responsiveness
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Page remains interactive and responsive without any display issues

TestCaseName: TC#031 - Process Monitor page remains visible after tab switch for UnconfiguredClient
Description: Verify that the Process Monitor page remains responsive and does not go blank after switching tabs, even when the client has no configured database.

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor with an unconfigured client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page displays error or default view due to missing database config

Steps.StepName: Open a new browser tab and navigate to an external site
Steps.StepExpectedResult: New tab opens and loads the external site

Steps.StepName: Wait for 2 minutes in the new tab
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Simulates user inactivity on the original tab

Steps.StepName: Switch back to the original Process Monitor tab
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Original tab is restored in focus

Steps.StepName: Interact with the Process Monitor page to verify responsiveness
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Page remains interactive and responsive without going blank

TestCaseName: TC#032 - Verify tooltips for 'Type' and 'Source' columns in Process Monitor UI
Description: Ensure that hovering over the 'Type' and 'Source' cells in the Process Monitor table displays the correct tooltips.

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Vantage and navigate to Process Monitor
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Filtered data is loaded and displayed in the table

Steps.StepName: Hover over 'Type' column in the first row
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Tooltip appears with the correct 'Type' description

Steps.StepName: Hover over 'Source' column in the first row
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Tooltip appears with the correct 'Source' description

TestCaseName: TC#033 - Add New Client in Process Monitor
Description: Verify that a new client can be added successfully with all required configurations in Process Monitor.

Steps.StepName: Open Eclipse Analytics URL
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Eclipse Analytics page is loaded

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Client Configuration via Settings Gear Icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Client Configuration page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Click 'Add New Client' button
Steps.StepExpectedResult: New Client form is displayed

Steps.StepName: Enter generated client name and description
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Client name and description fields are populated

Steps.StepName: Click Create button
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Client creation process is initiated

Steps.StepName: Select tenants and add required products (Eclipse Dev Tenant, Eclipse Analytics, Platform Administration, Process Monitoring)
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Tenants and products are selected correctly

Steps.StepName: Click Save button
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Client configuration is saved successfully

TestCaseName: TC#034 - Add Created Client to Test User with Multiple Roles
Description: Verify that the created client can be added as active to the test user with multiple roles assigned.

Steps.StepName: Open home URL
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Home page is loaded

Steps.StepName: Navigate to User Section via Settings Gear Icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: User Section page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Search for Test User by email 'TestAutomation02@EclipseDevelopmentTest.onmicrosoft.com'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Test User profile is displayed

Steps.StepName: Click Edit on the Test User profile
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Edit User page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Select Eclipse Dev Tenant and add another client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Tenant selected and new client add option available

Steps.StepName: Select latest client dropdown and choose the created client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Created client is selected

Steps.StepName: Add multiple roles (Process Log, File Manager, Administrator) for the selected client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Roles are assigned successfully

Steps.StepName: Save the changes
Steps.StepExpectedResult: User client and roles are saved correctly

TestCaseName: TC#035 - Add 'review' Client to Test User with Multiple Roles
Description: Verify that the 'review' client can be added as active to the test user with multiple roles assigned.

Steps.StepName: Open home URL
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Home page is loaded

Steps.StepName: Navigate to User Section via Settings Gear Icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: User Section page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Search for Test User by email 'TestAutomation02@EclipseDevelopmentTest.onmicrosoft.com'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Test User profile is displayed

Steps.StepName: Click Edit on the Test User profile
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Edit User page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Add another client and select 'review' client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: 'review' client is selected

Steps.StepName: Add multiple roles (Process Log, File Manager, Administrator) for 'review' client
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Roles are assigned successfully

Steps.StepName: Save the changes
Steps.StepExpectedResult: User client and roles are saved correctly

TestCaseName: TC#036 - Verify Process Monitor Product Presence in Settings Menu
Description: Ensure the Process Monitor product is displayed in the settings menu.

Steps.StepName: Click on the Settings Gear Icon
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Settings menu is opened

Steps.StepName: Verify Process Monitor product is listed
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor product is visible

TestCaseName: TC#037 - Validate Column Headers in Process Monitor Table
Description: Verify that all expected column headers are present in the Process Monitor table after applying filters.

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor product in settings
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Filtered data is loaded

Steps.StepName: Verify table column headers
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Headers include Type, Id, Description, Client, Source, Processed On, Duration, State, Disposition

TestCaseName: TC#038 - Validate 'State' Column Values in Process Monitor Table Rows
Description: Verify each row's 'State' column contains valid values as per API response.

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor product
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Filtered data is loaded

Steps.StepName: Fetch valid 'State' values from API
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Valid state names list is retrieved

Steps.StepName: Verify each table row's 'State' value matches valid API names
Steps.StepExpectedResult: All 'State' values in rows are valid

TestCaseName: TC#039 - Validate 'Type' Column Values in Process Monitor Table Rows
Description: Verify each row's 'Type' column contains valid values ('Payor Contract Analysis', 'Receive File').

Steps.StepName: Navigate to Process Monitor product
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Process Monitor page is displayed

Steps.StepName: Apply filters: client='processdb', date='Last30Days'
Steps.StepExpectedResult: Filtered data is loaded

Steps.StepName: Verify each table row's 'Type' value is among valid types
Steps.StepExpectedResult: All 'Type' values in rows are valid
